# Website Structure and Deployment Guide

This document explains the structure of the personal portfolio website and provides instructions for deploying it to GitHub Pages at `shhreya-anand.github.io`.

## Repository Structure

The website follows a standard HTML/CSS/JavaScript structure based on the Massively template from HTML5 UP.

### Directory Structure

```
Shhreya-website/
├── index.html          # Main homepage
├── generic.html        # About page
├── elements.html       # Elements reference page
├── assets/
│   ├── css/           # Stylesheets
│   │   ├── main.css   # Main stylesheet
│   │   └── noscript.css
│   ├── js/            # JavaScript files
│   │   ├── main.js    # Main JavaScript
│   │   ├── jquery.min.js
│   │   └── ...        # Other JS dependencies
│   ├── sass/          # SASS source files (for development)
│   └── webfonts/      # Font Awesome fonts
├── images/            # Image assets
│   ├── bg.jpg
│   ├── overlay.png
│   └── pic01.jpg - pic09.jpg
├── LICENSE.txt
└── README.txt
```

## Page Locations

### Main Pages

1. **`index.html`** - Homepage
   - Location: Root of `Shhreya-website/` directory
   - Purpose: Main landing page with portfolio introduction
   - Features:
     - Hero section with introduction
     - Featured post section
     - Portfolio/blog post grid
     - Contact form in footer
   - Navigation: Links to Home (active), About, Elements

2. **`generic.html`** - About Page
   - Location: Root of `Shhreya-website/` directory
   - Purpose: Generic content page (can be used for About, Blog posts, etc.)
   - Features:
     - Full-width content area
     - Image support
     - Contact form in footer
   - Navigation: Links to Home, About (active), Elements

3. **`elements.html`** - Elements Reference
   - Location: Root of `Shhreya-website/` directory
   - Purpose: Reference page showing all available HTML elements and styles
   - Features:
     - Comprehensive element showcase
     - Form elements
     - Typography examples
     - Button styles
   - Navigation: Links to Home, About, Elements (active)

## Asset Locations

### Stylesheets
- **Main CSS**: `assets/css/main.css`
- **NoScript CSS**: `assets/css/noscript.css` (for users with JavaScript disabled)

### JavaScript Files
All located in `assets/js/`:
- `main.js` - Main site functionality
- `jquery.min.js` - jQuery library
- `jquery.scrollex.min.js` - Scroll effects
- `jquery.scrolly.min.js` - Smooth scrolling
- `browser.min.js` - Browser detection
- `breakpoints.min.js` - Responsive breakpoints
- `util.js` - Utility functions

### Images
All images are stored in the `images/` directory:
- Background images: `bg.jpg`, `overlay.png`
- Portfolio images: `pic01.jpg` through `pic09.jpg`

## GitHub Pages Deployment

### Current Structure Issue

**IMPORTANT**: For GitHub Pages to work correctly, the website files need to be in the **root** of the repository named `Shhreya-Anand.github.io`, not in a subdirectory.

Currently, files are located at:
```
Shhreya-Anand.github.io/Shhreya-website/
```

They should be moved to:
```
Shhreya-Anand.github.io/  (root level)
```

### Deployment Steps

1. **Move Files to Repository Root**
   - Copy all files from `Shhreya-website/` to the root of `Shhreya-Anand.github.io/`
   - The repository structure should be:
     ```
     Shhreya-Anand.github.io/
     ├── index.html
     ├── generic.html
     ├── elements.html
     ├── assets/
     ├── images/
     └── ...
     ```

2. **Initialize Git Repository** (if not already done)
   ```bash
   cd Shhreya-Anand.github.io
   git init
   git add .
   git commit -m "Initial commit"
   ```

3. **Connect to GitHub**
   ```bash
   git remote add origin https://github.com/Shhreya-Anand/Shhreya-Anand.github.io.git
   git branch -M main
   git push -u origin main
   ```

4. **Enable GitHub Pages**
   - Go to repository settings on GitHub
   - Navigate to "Pages" section
   - Select source: "Deploy from a branch"
   - Choose branch: `main`
   - Select folder: `/ (root)`
   - Click "Save"

5. **Access Your Site**
   - Your site will be available at: `https://shhreya-anand.github.io`
   - It may take a few minutes for changes to propagate

### Alternative: Using a Subdirectory

If you prefer to keep files in the `Shhreya-website/` subdirectory:

1. In GitHub Pages settings, set the source to `/docs` folder
2. Create a `docs/` folder in the root
3. Move all website files to `docs/`
4. Update the site URL: `https://shhreya-anand.github.io/Shhreya-website/`

**Note**: This is not recommended as it adds an extra path to your URL.

## Customization Notes

### To Update Content

1. **Homepage**: Edit `index.html`
   - Update the intro section (lines 21-26)
   - Modify the featured post section (lines 52-63)
   - Update portfolio/blog posts (lines 66-137)

2. **About Page**: Edit `generic.html`
   - Update the header section (lines 45-52)
   - Modify the content paragraphs (lines 54-55)

3. **Images**: Replace images in `images/` directory
   - Update image references in HTML files
   - Recommended sizes: 1200x600px for featured images

### To Update Styling

- **Quick changes**: Edit `assets/css/main.css`
- **Advanced changes**: Modify SASS files in `assets/sass/` and recompile

### To Update Contact Information

Edit the footer section in any HTML file (around lines 179-202):
- Update address
- Update phone number
- Update email
- Modify social media links

## Browser Compatibility

This template supports:
- Modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
- Responsive design for mobile devices
- Graceful degradation for older browsers
